Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2008 02:36PM jmyers wrote: Ins, We are thinking of you through the waiting process.
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy jmyers Justine

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2008 08:27PM jmyers wrote: Well it's the night before my biopsy.  I was a little unnerved leaving work this after but I've been keeping pretty busy so far so I've not had much time to wait.  After reading the othe comments above. I've decided to take my MP3 player with me.    I'll be back on after the appointment. Laughingwater,   I'll be thinking of you tomorrow as well.  My appointment is at 8am.  Thank you for kind words about my Dad.  Dad is doing much better.  He has his follow up appointment tomorrow as well. My husband is taking him for me.  (Since we have decided not to tell him anything until we know more what is going on.)  As for the brother-in-law who is the dentist sign me up for the happy gas as well.    I've not heard if they give us anything for pain afterwards.
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy jmyers Justine

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2008 02:26PM jmyers wrote: Well the biopsy is over.  I kept it together.  Did not use my mp3 player.   My team of ladies was really good and very concerned about me and how I was doing.  My sore now but I have pain meds to get me through.  I'm going to go lay down now.  I just wanted to thank everyone for their support. Laughingwater,  I hope yours went well too!
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy jmyers Justine

Posts.Content: jmyers wrote: I had my first mammogram on 02/16/2008.  On 02/21/2008 I received a letter advising me that I needed to schedule a right diagnostic and an ultrasound.  I went for those tests yesterday.  The radiologist found a small cyst but said it was fibrous tissue.  But there is an area above it that they are concered with when the mammogram magnified it showed lots of calicifcations and she recommends a mammtone biopsy which I have scheduled on 03/11/08 at 8am.  I'm new to this and unfortunately an ultimate pessimest.  I would rather prepare for the worst and be plesantly surprised that it's begin.  I'm scared.  I have no history on my Dad's side but I do not know about my mom's side and she's been gone since 07/98.  The waiting is killing me and eveyone I talk to say DON'T Worry but you can't help but worry. Jackie Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy jmyers Justine

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2008 11:04PM jmyers wrote: Thank you.  I am trying to get out from under the cloud.  It's just nice to have some people understand.  My husband is being great but he does not understand (although he is trying)  He went with me for the 2nd scan and the ultrasound. And will be going with me for the biopsy.
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy jmyers Justine

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2008 02:35PM jmyers wrote: Laughingwater.  One thing I have not told everyone  is last year I moved my Dad here from Milwaukee, WI for health reasons as he is getting older.  Has has Chronic heart disease for 20 yrs. Durning February he was in the ER four times.  In the middle of that is when I went in for my first mammogram.  So I've been dealing with him, work stress, and the stress of not knowing.  I just wanted the roller coaster to stop so I could get off for a bit.  Now that I've had a few days I'm doing much better.  I'm sure tomorrow the day before the procedure or the day of my nerves will kick back in. I would be happ to hold your cyber hand through this.  Sounds like we are having the same procedure done though.  I will be back on later that day and let eveyone know how it went. I to would like to thank all veterans for their thoughts and wisdom through this stressful time.
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy jmyers Justine

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2008 05:43PM jmyers wrote: Welp. Day two after the biopsy.  I'm not as sore only pushing pulling and going down stairs seem to hurt now.   Going crazy waiting for my phone to ring with the results though.
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy jmyers Justine

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2008 05:57PM jmyers wrote: Well results are in and I am happy to report B9!!!!! My doctor stated it was basically some scaring from long ago that is not cancer and will not be be cancer in 50 years.  (What a relief.) I did not realize how much this was really weighing me until I heard those words.  I kept wanting to burst into happy tears off and on all day.   We are going out to celebrate tonight.  I think I have earned it and then some.  Thank you to everyone for their kind words and support throughout this time in my life.  I can not tell you how much it meant to have other people just listen.
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy jmyers Justine

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2008 06:06PM jmyers wrote: Well day two after the biopsy.  I'm doing a little better.  Driving seems really make me hurt.  Motrin did not help much at work today.  But I'm home now and do not plan on doing much at all.    Good Luck to others out there waiting for their procedures.  I'm wishing those of us waiting for results extremely boring normal results.
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy jmyers Justine

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2008 06:06PM jmyers wrote: Maryannecb, You are the first to tell me that it's my job for the moment. I plan to follow through with the next steps.  I'm trying to stay busy.  But I've been experiencing some anexiety with this and work.  I would just like to relax for a while.  Just not sure how right now.
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy jmyers Justine

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2008 08:29PM jmyers wrote: Stacyr, I'm sorry you had such a rough appointment.  I'm taking my mp3 player with me tomorrow am.  I'm hoping I can keep it together.
